docs.title: Home
docs.text:
U.S.E. Finance Data Hub

This site is maintained by the Finance section of Utrecht University School of Economics (U.S.E.) and is primarily intended for UU students and researchers. It provides documentation and manuals for accessing and working with financial data.

UU students and staff: if you need help with data access or have questions about available resources, contact financedata.use@uu.nl

docs.title: How to Get a FactSet Account
Step 1: Register as a Student
docs.text:
Go to the FactSet Academic Student Registration page and fill in the form:

  • Email: Use your @students.uu.nl email address
  • University Name: Universiteit Utrecht
  • Academic Degree: Select the appropriate option
  • Expected Graduation Date: Use 08/YYYY (August of the year you graduate), e.g. 08/2026

docs.title: Step 2: Receive Your Credentials
docs.text: You will receive your FactSet user ID and password by email. Check your spam folder if you do not see it.

docs.title: Step 3: Access FactSet
docs.text:
There are two options to use FactSet:

Option 1: Solis Workspace (remote desktop)

FactSet is installed on Solis Workspace. After activating your FactSet ID, open FactSet there and enter your credentials.

Option 2: Download FactSet on your own computer

Download FactSet from https://www.factset.com/download and choose General Release.

  • Includes a very useful Excel Plugin
  • Not available for Apple (sorry)

docs.title: Important Notes
docs.text: • Even after receiving a confirmation email, FactSet might need some time to give full access rights (verification of the UU license).

docs.title: Available Data
docs.text:
FactSet provides a wide range of financial data and analytics:

  • Company fundamentals — financial statements, ratios, and estimates for public companies worldwide
  • Equity and fixed income pricing — historical and real-time price data across global markets
  • Ownership data — institutional and insider holdings, fund flows
  • Industry classifications — FactSet RBICS (Revere Business Industry Classification System) for sector and industry screening
  • Screening and charting — built-in tools for filtering companies by financial criteria and creating visualizations
  • Excel plugin — pull FactSet data directly into Excel spreadsheets using FactSet formulas and the sidebar

docs.title: Using FactSet
docs.text: Our colleague Jeroen Derwall (personal page, research portal) has recorded a series of short clips on how to use FactSet.

LSEG Workspace is a financial data and analytics platform provided by the London Stock Exchange Group (formerly Refinitiv Eikon / Thomson Reuters Eikon). It offers real-time and historical data on equities, fixed income, commodities, foreign exchange, and more, along with news, analytics, and screening tools.
